none: Letter 'to whomever it may concern' from A. C. Brietz, June 3, 1891
Letter 'to whomever it may concern' from A. C. Brietz, June 3, 1891
Box 2 Louis L. McInnis Papers/Box 2 Folder 7 Louis L. McInnis Papers

en: A letter of attestation from attorney A. C. Brietz to whom it may concern, dated June 3, 1891, documenting his request to Professor L. L. McInnis to assist in securing increased appropriations for the Agricultural and Mechanical College before the Texas House Finance Committee. Brietz confirms that McInnis agreed to provide his services and travel to Austin as needed to support efforts to increase the college's appropriation beyond the amounts recommended by the Finance Committee.

body.value:
OFFICE OF
A. C. BRIETZ,
Attorney at Law,

Practices in the 20th Judicial District, in the
Supreme Court and Court of Appeals at
Austin and Galveston, and any-
where in the State when
specially retained.

Bryan, Texas, June 3d 1891

To whom it may concern-

At the request of Dr J. W. Howell. I make the
following statement - While Prof L. L. McInnis
was in Austin a few days before the appropiation
bill was taken up before the committee of the
whole in the House- I had a conversation with
him in relation to the appropiation for the A & M
College- I told him that I was going to make
an effort to get an increase of the amounts
reported in the Bill by the Finance Committee
and asked him, if I needed his services in
the matter, if he would aid me in obtaining
increased appropiations: He very readily con-
-sented to do so. and agreed to come to
Austin for this purpose, at any time I
might telegraph him to come-

A.C. Brietz
